title: 1 Dead, 3 Missing After Small Plane Crashes Off Coast Of Long Island
content: One person was killed when a small plane crashed Saturday off the coast of Long Island.    The U.S. Coast Guard said the Piper PA31 Navajo aircraft went down around 3 p.m., approximately one mile offshore near Indian Wells Beach in Amagansett.    Four people were on board at the time. One was killed, three others are missing.    East Hampton Police told CBS2 it was a group of family and friends that was flying out of East Hampton Airport.    The FAA, National Transportation Safety Board and others are on scene to investigate the cause of the crash.    Check back with CBSNewYork.com for more on this developing story.
